data.title: Upcoming Events — Kitka Women's Vocal Ensemble
data.text:
Kitka in Concert - Oakland, CA

Kitka performs at New Music Bay Area’s annual Summer Solstice festival of new music, The Garden of Memory.

View Event →

Special Appearance with Ivo Dimchev

Kitka backs up Bulgaria’s trailblazing queer singer-songwriter and performance artist Ivo Dimchev in a special intimate performance.

View Event →

KITKA IN CONCERT - San Francisco, CA

Kitka joins forces with Balaklava Blues for a thrilling collaboration that falls somewhere between a traditional song cycle and a full-blown multimedia techno show.

View Event →

KITKA IN CONCERT - Berkeley, CA

Kitka joins forces with Balaklava Blues for a thrilling collaboration that falls somewhere between a traditional song cycle and a full-blown multimedia techno show.

Voice of Roma Herdeljezi Festival Community Music and Dance Workshops

Voice of Roma partners with The Kitka Institute to present a full day of participatory workshops in Romani ("G*psy") singing, instrumental music, and dance lead by this year's featured Herdeljezi Festival artists.

View Event →

SOLD OUT! Special Appearance with Sleepytime Gorilla Museum - Berkeley, CA

Kitka, Faun Fables, Cassette Prophet, Surplus 1980, and other surprise guests will be joining the legendary Bay Area band Sleepytime Gorilla Museum for an eclectic evening of music and performance as the grand finale of Sleepytime Gorilla Museum’s reunion tour.

SOLD OUT! Wintersongs Community Sing with Kitka - Oakland

Advanced reservations required.

Join Kitka in a celebratory circle of song! Experience the magic of raising your voice to create lush Eastern European seasonal harmonies as they were originally intended to be sung by many voices in community! Kitka singers will lead the group in some fun "open voice" warm-ups, and will teach a varied selection of favorite tunes from our Wintersongs repertoire. The songs presented promise to be accessible, beautiful, and interesting. This Community Sing is designed to be very inclusive. Singers of all ages are welcome and no experience is necessary.

Pulse of the Mahala: Balkan/Romani Percussion Workshops with Rumen "Sali" Shopov

B ulgarian-born Turkish Romani master percussionist, multi-instrumentalist, band leader, and vocalist Rumen "Sali" Shopov offers a series of four workshops exploring traditional drumming techniques and the unique odd-metered dance rhythms of Bulgaria, Macedonia, Turkey, and Greece.

View Event →
